submission.title: Mandatory Metadata for AI-Generated Artifacts
submission.overview: This submission proposes a requirement that generative AI applications hosted on websites embed clear, machine-readable metadata in all digital artifacts they create—including podcasts, audio, video, images, and text—indicating that the content was generated by AI. This submission was generated with protocol META-DP-EVAL-v1.3

directly_addressed_dps.summary: Reinforces the need for transparency in AI-generated content by requiring metadata that identifies such content explicitly.
Ensures digital provenance by embedding AI-origin metadata, allowing verification of content origin and authenticity.
Supports ethical standards by preventing deceptive use of AI-generated artifacts and enabling informed content consumption.

clarifications_and_extensions.title: Metadata Signaling for AI-Generated Content
clarifications_and_extensions.clarification: All content generated by AI must include metadata that signals its artificial origin, allowing both humans and systems to recognize and treat it accordingly.
clarifications_and_extensions.why_it_matters: Without clear metadata, AI-generated content can be mistaken for human-authored work, leading to misinformation, impersonation, or eroded trust.

clarifications_and_extensions.title: Embedded Origin Markers
clarifications_and_extensions.extension: Proposes that all AI systems capable of generating media must embed verifiable markers indicating content origin and generation parameters.
clarifications_and_extensions.why_it_matters: These markers enable tracking and auditing of digital artifacts, supporting provenance verification and mitigating malicious reuse.
